meanings.definition: To restore the status of money to (something)
meanings.sent1: After losing value, he remonetizes his old coins to make them valuable again.
meanings.sent2: The government remonetizes the outdated currency to improve the economy.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank magically remonetizes all the coins inside every night.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work remonetizes her efforts into success.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth remonetizes the frozen landscape into a lush garden.

meanings.sent1: She remonetizes her unused items by selling them online.
meanings.sent2: The pawnshop remonetizes the old jewelry for cash.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick remonetizes the paper into a hundred-dollar bill.
meanings.sent4: His creativity remonetizes his hobby into a profitable business.
meanings.sent5: The charity remonetizes the donated goods to fund their cause.
